longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to introduce measures to minimize the environmental impact of certain types of products; and to provide for related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Product Eco-responsibility Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Purposes of this Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: The purposes of this Ordinance are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to minimize the environmental impact of various types of products, which may include plastic shopping bags and other plastic products, vehicle tyres, electrical and electronic equipment, packaging materials, beverage containers and rechargeable batteries; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to that end, to introduce producer responsibility schemes, schemes based on the “polluter pays” principle, or other measures, which may require manufacturers, importers, wholesalers, retailers, consumers or any other parties to share the responsibility for the reduction in the use, or the recovery, recycling or proper disposal, of those products.

subsection.leadIn: Such schemes or measures may include (but are not limited to) the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the imposition of a recycling levy or fee to finance the proper waste management of certain products; (Amended 3 of 2016 s. 3)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the imposition of an environmental levy or a charge to discourage the use of certain products; (Amended 4 of 2014 s. 3)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the restriction on the disposal of certain products at any designated waste disposal facility as defined in section 2 of the Waste Disposal (Designated Waste Disposal Facility) Regulation (Cap. 354 sub. leg. L); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the prohibition or restriction on the manufacture, sale, supply, distribution, use or display of certain products. (Added 27 of 2023 s. 31)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance— (Amended 35 of 2025 s. 4)
subsection.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means a public officer authorized under section 6;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company incorporated outside Hong Kong; (Added 4 of 2014 s. 4)

subsection.def: Director (署長) means the Director of Environmental Protection;
disposable (即棄)—see section 3C; (Added 27 of 2023 s. 32)
made of oxo-degradable plastic (氧化式可分解塑膠製)—see section 3B; (Added 27 of 2023 s. 32)
made of plastic (塑膠製)—see section 3A; (Added 27 of 2023 s. 32)
plastic (塑膠)—see section 3A; (Added 27 of 2023 s. 32)
plastic shopping bag (塑膠購物袋) means a plastic shopping bag to which this Ordinance applies according to section 18;
prescribed product (訂明產品) means any product mentioned in section 4;
product (產品) includes any article, material and substance;

def.name: RegulatedElectricalEquipment
def.leadIn: regulated electrical equipment (受管制電器) means electrical equipment or electronic equipment that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is set out in column 2 of Part 1 of Schedule 6 and is defined in column 3 of that Part; and (Amended 27 of 2023 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been used by any consumer as defined by section 31,

def.continued: but does not include e-waste as defined by section 2(1) of the Waste Disposal Ordinance (Cap. 354); (Added 3 of 2016 s. 4)

subsection.def: regulated plastic product (受規管塑膠產品) means a product the manufacture, supply (within the meaning of section 59) or display of which is prohibited or restricted under Part 6, or is subject to a requirement under that Part; (Added 27 of 2023 s. 32)
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Environment and Ecology. (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance— (Amended 35 of 2025 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to any product includes a reference to any part of the product;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a function includes a reference to a power and a duty; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference to the performance of a function includes a reference to the exercise of a power and the discharge of a duty.

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Meanings of plastic and made of plastic

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, plastic is a material consisting of a polymer (other than a natural polymer that has not been chemically modified), whether or not an additive or any other substance has been added to the material.
For the purposes of this Ordinance, a product is made of plastic if it is wholly or partly made of a material mentioned in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), if the polymer of which a material mentioned in subsection (1) consists—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is used merely as an additive in the production of the material; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not function as a major structural component of the product,

subsection.continued: the material is to be disregarded in determining whether or not the product is made of plastic.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: major structural component (主要結構組成部分), in relation to a product, means a component of the product that is capable of maintaining its form without a substrate. Example— A laminated layer on the surface of a product.

section.name: s3B
section.heading: Meaning of made of oxo-degradable plastic
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a product is made of oxo-degradable plastic if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is made of plastic; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is added to the plastic an additive that, through oxidation, would lead to fragmentation of the plastic into micro-fragments or to chemical decomposition of the plastic.

section.name: s3C
section.heading: Meaning of disposable
section.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a product is disposable if it is not designed to be used for the purpose for which it was designed more than once, or on more than one occasion, before being disposed of.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Prescribed products to which Part 2 applies
section.content: This Part applies in relation to plastic shopping bags, regulated electrical equipment, regulated articles and regulated plastic products.

section.name: s5
section.heading: General provisions as to regulations made under this Ordinance

subsection.def: In this section, regulation (規例) means any regulation made under section 29, 44, 55 or 100. (Amended 3 of 2016 s. 6; 13 of 2016 s. 5; 27 of 2023 s. 35)

subsection.leadIn: A regulation may do all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: apply generally or be limited in its application by reference to specified exceptions or factors;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for a particular case or class of cases;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: empower the Secretary or Director to grant exemptions from any requirement, either generally or in a particular case;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for the performance by the Director or an authorized officer of any function under the regulation;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: authorize any matter or thing to be determined, applied or administered by a specified person or group of persons;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: prescribe any matter that by this Ordinance is required or permitted to be prescribed by a regulation;

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: specify an appealable matter mentioned in section 13; (Added 3 of 2016 s. 6)

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: generally provide for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A regulation may make it an offence for a person to do or omit to do any specified act and may authorize—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the imposition of a fine, not exceeding $500,000, for such an offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the offence is a continuing one, the imposition of a further fine of $10,000 for each day or part of a day during which the offence has continued; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the imposition of a sentence of imprisonment for a period of not more than 12 months.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Authorized officers

subsection.content: The Director may, in writing, authorize a public officer not below the rank of Environmental Protection Inspector to perform such functions of the Director or an authorized officer under this Ordinance as are specified in the authorization.
When performing a function under this Ordinance, an authorized officer must, if required, produce his written authorization granted under this section.
An authorized officer performing a function under this Ordinance may take with him such persons as he reasonably requires to assist him in the performance of the function.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Powers to obtain information, enter places for routine inspection, etc.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer may, in relation to any record or document required to be kept by a person under this Ordinance, do all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require the person to produce the record or document for inspection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the person to provide all reasonable assistance, information or explanations in connection with the record or document;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove and retain the record or document for such period as may be reasonably necessary for further examination or reproduction, or until the relevant proceedings under this Ordinance have been heard and finally determined.

subsection.content: An authorized officer may require a person to provide any information that is in the possession or under the control of the person and is reasonably necessary to enable the officer to ascertain whether this Ordinance has been or is being complied with. (Amended 4 of 2014 s. 5; 3 of 2016 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of ascertaining whether this Ordinance has been or is being complied with, an authorized officer may, at any reasonable time, enter a place to which the public are permitted to have access, and may do all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: observe and inspect any activity, operation, process or procedure involving prescribed products;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require a person in charge of the place to produce any record or document relating to prescribed products or to any levy, charge or fee imposed under this Ordinance; (Amended 4 of 2014 s. 5)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make copies of any record or document produced under paragraph (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (4), take such samples of any products as the officer may reasonably require for the purpose of examination and investigation.

subsection.leadIn: If required by the person having the lawful custody of such products, the authorized officer shall pay for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the market price of the samples he proposes to take; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the market price is unknown or not readily ascertainable, a reasonable price of those samples.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, a person is not liable for breach of any duty of confidentiality arising from the disclosure of any information that he is required to provide under this Ordinance.

An authorized officer must not disclose any record, document or information produced or provided to him under this section unless he is satisfied that it is necessary to make the disclosure for the purposes of any proceedings under this Ordinance.
In this section, a reference to a person includes a reference to anyone acting for or on behalf of the person.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Power of entry and search

subsection.content: Where a warrant has been issued under subsection (2) in respect of a place, an authorized officer may enter and search the place in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing an authorized officer to enter and search a place only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for suspecting that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an offence against this Ordinance has been or is being committed in the place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: there is in the place anything that constitutes, or is likely to constitute, evidence that an offence against this Ordinance has been or is being committed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the magistrate is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is not practicable to communicate with a person entitled to grant entry to the place;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such a person has unreasonably refused entry to the place by an authorized officer;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an authorized officer apprehends on reasonable grounds that entry to the place is unlikely to be granted unless a warrant is issued; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the purpose of entry to the place would be prejudiced unless an authorized officer arriving at the place can secure immediate entry.

subsection.content: An authorized officer who enters and searches a place under a warrant must, if required, produce the warrant for inspection.
A warrant issued under this section continues in force until the purpose for which the entry is necessary has been satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized officer who enters a place under this section may do all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require any person present at the place to provide such assistance or information as may be necessary to enable the officer to perform his functions under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: search and seize anything that the officer reasonably believes to be evidence of the commission of an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: retain the thing for such period as may be reasonably necessary for further examination or reproduction, or until the relevant proceedings under this Ordinance have been heard and finally determined.

subsection.content: An authorized officer must perform his functions under this section at a reasonable hour unless he believes that the purpose of their performance could be frustrated if he performs them at a reasonable hour.

subsection.def: In this section, place (地方) includes any vehicle and vessel.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Providing false information, etc.

subsection.content: A person who, in purported compliance with this Ordinance, produces or provides any record, document or information that is false or misleading in any material particular commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (1) for the person charged to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he did not know and had no reason to believe the record, document or information to be false or misleading; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he exercised due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, omits any material particular from any record, document or information required to be produced or provided by him under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Obstructing authorized officers, etc.

subsection.content: A person who wilfully obstructs or delays an authorized officer in the performance of any of his functions under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement properly made of him by an authorized officer under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Offences by body corporate

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a body corporate commits an offence under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of a director of, or a person concerned in the management of, the body corporate,

section.continued: the director or that person also commits the offence and is liable on conviction to the penalty provided.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 5 of Part 2
section.def: appeal (上訴) means an appeal made under section 13;
Appeal Board (上訴委員會) means the Appeal Board established by section 14(1);
Deputy Chairman (副主席) means the Deputy Chairman of the Appeal Board appointed under section 14(4);
panel member (備選委員) means a member of the panel of persons appointed under section 14(3).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Appeals

subsection.content: A person who is aggrieved by a decision of a public officer relating to an appealable matter may, within 21 days after the date on which the notice about that matter is served on him, appeal to the Appeal Board by giving a notice of appeal to the Director stating the reasons for the appeal. (Amended 4 of 2014 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: appealable matter (可上訴事宜) means a matter that is specified in this Ordinance as a matter on which an appeal may be made under this section. (Replaced 4 of 2014 s. 6. Amended 3 of 2016 s. 8)

section.name: s14
section.heading: Establishment of Appeal Board

subsection.content: There is established an Appeal Board for the purpose of hearing and determining an appeal.
The Chief Executive shall appoint as Chairman of the Appeal Board a person who is legally qualified and not a public officer.
The Chief Executive shall also appoint a panel of persons whom he considers to be suitable for appointment as members of the Appeal Board and who are not public officers.
The Chief Executive shall appoint as Deputy Chairman of the Appeal Board one of the panel members who is legally qualified.
The Chairman, the Deputy Chairman and a panel member shall be appointed for a term of not more than 3 years but may be reappointed.
Every appointment under this section must be published in the Gazette.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Exercise of Appeal Board’s jurisdiction

subsection.content: The Appeal Board may exercise its jurisdiction in hearing and determining an appeal only if it is duly constituted.

subsection.leadIn: The Appeal Board is duly constituted for the purpose of hearing and determining an appeal if it consists of the following members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairman; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least 2 other members appointed by the Chairman from among the panel members to hear the appeal.

subsection.content: On an appeal, the Appeal Board may confirm, reverse or vary a decision under appeal.

Every question before the Appeal Board shall be determined by the opinion of the majority of the Chairman and the panel members hearing the appeal except a question of law which shall be determined by the Chairman.
In the event of an equality of votes, the Chairman has a casting vote.

subsection.leadIn: The Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive evidence on oath;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: admit or take into account any statement, document, information or matter whether or not it would be admissible as evidence in a court of law;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice in writing summon any person to appear before it to produce any document or to give evidence; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: award such amount for costs in an appeal as is just and equitable in the circumstances of the case.

subsection.content: The party awarded any costs may enforce the award as a civil debt.
Costs awarded against the Director or an authorized officer are charged on the general revenue.
The Chairman may determine any form or matter of practice or procedure in so far as no provision is made for it in this Ordinance.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Supplementary provisions as to Appeal Board

subsection.content: If the Chairman is precluded by any cause from performing his functions during any period, the Deputy Chairman shall act as Chairman and as such perform all of the functions of the Chairman during that period.

If both the Chairman and the Deputy Chairman are precluded by any cause from performing their functions during any period, the Chief Executive may appoint any other person who is legally qualified and not a public officer to act as Chairman and as such to perform all of the functions of the Chairman during that period.

If a panel member appointed under section 15 to hear an appeal is precluded by any cause from performing his functions during any period, the Chairman may appoint any other panel member to act in his place during that period.
The Chairman, the Deputy Chairman or any panel member may at any time resign his office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a change in the membership of the Appeal Board (whether in respect of the Chairman or any other member) during the hearing of an appeal, the following applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case where the Appeal Board remains duly constituted according to section 15(2) without the participation of any new or acting member, the Appeal Board may continue the hearing despite the change;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if paragraph (a) does not apply and every party to the appeal consents, the Appeal Board may continue the hearing after reconstitution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case, the Appeal Board shall start the hearing afresh after reconstitution.

subsection.content: Any party to an appeal may be represented by a legal representative in the proceedings before the Appeal Board.
The Chairman may, before an appeal is determined, refer a question of law to the Court of Appeal by way of case stated.
In addition to the other powers of the Court of Appeal in hearing a case stated, the Court of Appeal may amend the case or order it to be sent back to the Chairman for amendment.

part.name: P2A
part.heading: Service of Notices under Parts 4 and 5

section.name: s16A
section.heading: Application of Part 2A
section.content: This Part applies in relation to regulated electrical equipment and regulated articles.

section.name: s16B
section.heading: Service of notices under Parts 4 and 5

subsection.leadIn: A notice required, or authorized, to be served on a person under Part 4 or 5 is to be regarded as duly served on the person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is sent by post—

subparagraph.content: if the person is a registered supplier—to the last address provided by the person to the Director; or
otherwise—to the person’s address last known to the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is sent by facsimile transmission—

subparagraph.content: if the person is a registered supplier—to the last facsimile number provided by the person to the Director; or
otherwise—to the person’s facsimile number last known to the Director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: it is sent by electronic mail—

subparagraph.content: if the person is a registered supplier—to the last electronic mail address provided by the person to the Director; or
otherwise—to the person’s electronic mail address last known to the Director; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the person has registered an account with an electronic system designated under section 16C(1)—it is sent to the account by means of the system.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), (c) or (d), a notice is to be regarded as having been sent by the means of transmission specified in that subsection if a record generated by the means establishes that the notice was so sent.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: registered supplier (登記供應商) means a registered supplier as defined by section 31 or 47.

section.name: s16C
section.heading: Designation of electronic system

subsection.content: The Director may, for the purposes of section 16B(1)(d), designate an electronic system.
The Director must, as soon as practicable after designating an electronic system under subsection (1), publish the details of the designation in a way that the Director considers appropriate.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3

subsection.leadIn: In this Part— (Amended 35 of 2025 s. 10)
subsection.def: specified form (指明格式) means a form specified under section 28MA. (Added 35 of 2025 s. 10)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Plastic shopping bags to which this Ordinance applies

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a bag prescribed in Schedule 1 is a plastic shopping bag to which this Ordinance applies.
This Ordinance does not apply to the plastic shopping bags prescribed in Schedule 2.

section.name: s18A
section.heading: Duty of seller to charge for plastic shopping bags

subsection.def: This section applies if there is a sale by retail of goods to a person (customer).

subsection.leadIn: The seller must charge the customer an amount not less than that prescribed in Schedule 3 for each plastic shopping bag, or each pre-packaged pack of 10 or more plastic shopping bags, provided by the seller directly or indirectly to the customer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time of the sale;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for promoting the goods; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: otherwise in connection with the sale.

subsection.content: The seller must not offer any rebate or discount to the customer with the effect of directly offsetting the amount charged under subsection (2) or any part of that amount.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a sale by retail of goods is a reference to a sale of goods to a person who obtains the goods for purposes other than wholesale; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a plastic shopping bag includes anything that can be easily turned into a plastic shopping bag.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: sale (出售) includes a display or offer for sale, and sale by retail (以零售方式出售) and seller (賣方) are to be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a plastic shopping bag is provided to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether it is provided as the subject of the sale or is provided in addition to the subject of the sale; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not it is provided together with another product as a single item of goods.

section.name: s18B
section.heading: Offences relating to section 18A

subsection.content: A person who contravenes section 18A(2) or (3) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 6 on the first occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence for contravening subsection (2) or (3) of section 18A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 on each subsequent occasion on which the person is convicted of the offence for contravening that subsection.

subsection.content: If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (1), it is a defence to prove that the person exercised due diligence to avoid committing the offence.

section.name: s18C
section.heading: Liability of franchisers and franchisees

subsection.content: This section applies if the sale mentioned in section 18A(1) is carried on in the course of a business under a franchise agreement.
Unless the Director otherwise agrees, the franchiser is the seller for the purposes of section 18A(2) and (3).

subsection.leadIn: If, because of an act or default of a franchisee, the franchiser commits an offence under section 18B(1), or would have committed the offence except for the reliance on the defence under section 18B(3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the franchisee also commits the offence and is liable on conviction to the penalty provided for the offence, whether or not the franchiser is charged with or convicted of the offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the franchisee may also rely on the defence under section 18B(3).

section.name: s21
section.heading: Secretary may amend Schedules

subsection.content: The Secretary may, after consultation with the Advisory Council on the Environment, by order published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 2 or 3.
An order made under this section to amend Schedule 1 or 2 is subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s28A
section.heading: Director may give penalty notice

subsection.content: This section applies if the Director has reason to believe that a person is committing or has committed a specified offence.

The Director may give the person a notice in the specified form offering the person an opportunity to discharge the person’s liability for the offence by paying a fixed penalty of $2,000 within 21 days after the date on which the notice is given. (Amended 35 of 2025 s. 11)
A penalty notice may be given to the person personally or by affixing it to the person’s place of business.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedOffence
def.leadIn: specified offence (指明罪行) means an offence under section 18B(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for contravening section 18A(2)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for contravening section 18A(3) by offering any rebate or discount to the customer with the effect of directly offsetting the amount charged under section 18A(2)(a) or any part of that amount.

section.name: s28B
section.heading: No prosecution or conviction if compliance with penalty notice

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who has been given a penalty notice in respect of an offence.
Subject to section 28F, the person is not liable to be prosecuted or convicted for the offence if the person has paid the fixed penalty within 21 days after the date on which the notice is given.

section.name: s28C
section.heading: Director may demand personal details and inspect proof of identity

subsection.content: This section applies if the Director has reason to believe that a person is committing or has committed an offence under section 18B(1).

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, for issuing or serving a summons or other document in relation to the offence, require the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to supply the person’s name, date of birth, address and contact telephone number (if any); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to produce for inspection the person’s proof of identity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a body corporate—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to supply the person’s corporate name, registered or principal office address and contact telephone number (if any); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to produce for inspection the person’s business registration certificate issued under section 6 of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310).

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement made under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.def: proof of identity (身分證明文件) has the same meaning as in section 17B of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115).

section.name: s28D
section.heading: Director may serve demand notice in case of failure to pay fixed penalty etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has been given a penalty notice in respect of an offence, and has not paid the fixed penalty within 21 days after the date on which the notice is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person refuses to accept a penalty notice intended to be given to the person in respect of an offence.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may serve on the person a notice in the specified form— (Amended 35 of 2025 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: demanding payment of the fixed penalty;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: informing the person that the person must notify the Director in writing if the person wishes to dispute liability for the offence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating that the payment or notification must be made within 10 days after the date on which the demand notice is served.

subsection.leadIn: A demand notice may not be served later than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(a) applies, 6 months after the date on which the penalty notice is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(b) applies, 6 months after the date on which the person refuses to accept the penalty notice.

subsection.content: A demand notice may be served by sending it by post to the person’s address (in the case of an individual) or the person’s registered or principal office address (in the case of a body corporate).
A certificate of posting in the specified form purporting to be signed by or for the Director is admissible in evidence in any proceedings under this Part. (Amended 35 of 2025 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Unless there is evidence to the contrary, it is presumed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the certificate of posting was signed by or for the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the demand notice to which the certificate of posting relates was duly served.

section.name: s28E
section.heading: No prosecution or conviction if compliance with demand notice

subsection.content: This section applies to a person on whom a demand notice has been served in respect of an offence.
Subject to section 28F, the person is not liable to be prosecuted or convicted for the offence if the person has paid the fixed penalty within 10 days after the date on which the notice is served.

section.name: s28F
section.heading: Withdrawal of penalty or demand notice

subsection.leadIn: The Director may withdraw a penalty notice given, or a demand notice served, in respect of an offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any time before a recovery order is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time before any proceedings for the offence commences.

subsection.leadIn: If a penalty or demand notice is withdrawn—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director must serve notice of the withdrawal on the person to whom, or on whom, the penalty or demand notice has been given or served; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on application by the person, the Director must refund, through the Director of Accounting Services, any amount paid for the fixed penalty.

subsection.leadIn: If a penalty or demand notice is withdrawn, proceedings for the offence may only be commenced where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ground, or one of the grounds, on which the notice is withdrawn is that it contains incorrect information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the incorrect information was supplied by the person to whom, or on whom, the notice was given or served.

section.name: s28G
section.heading: Recovery of fixed penalty

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a person on whom a demand notice has been served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to pay the fixed penalty in accordance with the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to notify the Director in accordance with the notice that the person wishes to dispute liability for the offence.

subsection.leadIn: On application made in the name of the Secretary for Justice and production of the documents specified in subsection (5), a magistrate must order the person to pay, within 14 days after the date of service of notice of the order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fixed penalty;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an additional penalty equal to the amount of the fixed penalty; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: $300 by way of costs.

subsection.content: An application may be made in the absence of the person. The Secretary for Justice may appoint a person or class of persons to make an application.

A magistrate must cause notice of a recovery order to be served on the person against whom it is made. The notice may be served by sending it by post to the person’s address (in the case of an individual) or the person’s registered or principal office address (in the case of a body corporate).

subsection.leadIn: The documents specified for subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the demand notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a certificate of posting the demand notice under section 28D(5); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: an evidentiary certificate, in the specified form, stating the following matters— (Amended 35 of 2025 s. 13)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the person specified in the certificate had not, before the date of the certificate, paid the fixed penalty;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: that the address specified in the certificate was, at the date specified in the certificate in relation to the address, the person’s address (in the case of an individual) or the person’s registered or principal office address (in the case of a body corporate).

subsection.content: An evidentiary certificate referred to in subsection (5)(c) and purporting to be signed by or for the Director is admissible in evidence in any proceedings under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Unless there is evidence to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is presumed that the evidentiary certificate was signed by or for the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the evidentiary certificate is evidence of the facts stated in it.

section.name: s28H
section.heading: Consequences of compliance with recovery order or failure to do so

subsection.content: This section applies to a person against whom a recovery order is made.
If the person has complied with the recovery order, the person is not liable to be prosecuted or convicted for the offence to which the order relates.

subsection.leadIn: If the person fails to comply with the recovery order, the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be regarded, for the purposes of section 68 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), as having failed to pay the sum adjudged to be paid by a conviction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is liable to be imprisoned under that section.

section.name: s28I
section.heading: Application for review of recovery order

subsection.content: A person against whom a recovery order is made may apply to a magistrate for review of the order.
An application must be made within 14 days after the date on which the recovery order first came to the personal notice of the applicant.
The applicant must give reasonable notice of the application to the Director.
An application may be made in person or by counsel or solicitor.

For securing the attendance of witnesses and generally for conducting the proceedings, the magistrate has all the powers of a magistrate hearing a complaint under the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227).

section.name: s28J
section.heading: Outcome of review

subsection.content: On application under section 28I, a magistrate may rescind a recovery order if the magistrate is satisfied that the demand notice did not come to the personal notice of the applicant without any fault of the applicant.
If the magistrate rescinds a recovery order, and the applicant wishes to dispute liability for the offence to which the order relates, the magistrate must give leave to that effect.

subsection.leadIn: If the magistrate rescinds a recovery order, and the applicant does not wish to dispute liability for the offence to which the order relates, the magistrate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must order the applicant to pay the fixed penalty within 10 days after the date of an order made under this paragraph; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must order that, if the applicant fails to pay the fixed penalty within that period, the applicant must immediately pay—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the fixed penalty;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an additional penalty equal to the amount of the fixed penalty; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: $300 by way of costs.

subsection.content: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), if a magistrate gives leave under subsection (2), proceedings may be taken within 6 months after the date on which the magistrate gives the leave.

subsection.leadIn: If the applicant fails to comply with the order under subsection (3)(b), the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be regarded, for the purposes of section 68 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), as having failed to pay the sum adjudged to be paid by a conviction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is liable to be imprisoned under that section.

subsection.content: If the applicant has complied with the order under subsection (3)(a) or (b), the applicant is not liable to be prosecuted or convicted for the offence to which the order relates.

section.name: s28K
section.heading: Power to rescind order on application by Director
section.leadIn: At any time, a magistrate may for good cause, on application by the Director, rescind—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an order for the payment of the fixed penalty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other order made under this Division in the same proceedings.

section.name: s28L
section.heading: Dispute of liability for offence

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has notified the Director in accordance with a demand notice that the person wishes to dispute liability for an offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been given leave to dispute liability for an offence under section 28J(2).

subsection.content: A summons issued in any proceedings against the person for the offence may be served on the person in accordance with section 8 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in consequence of the notification or leave, the person appears in any proceedings in answer to a summons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is convicted of the offence after having offered no defence or a defence that is frivolous or vexatious,

subsection.continued: the magistrate before whom the proceedings are heard must, in addition to any other penalty and costs, impose an additional penalty equal to the amount of the fixed penalty.

subsection.leadIn: Any proceedings taken against a person falling within subsection (1)(a) must terminate if the person pays in accordance with subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fixed penalty;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an additional penalty equal to the amount of the fixed penalty; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: $500 by way of costs.

subsection.content: Payment under subsection (4) must be made at any magistracy not less than 2 days before the day specified in the summons for the person’s appearance, and the summons must be produced at the time of the payment.
Neither a Saturday nor a public holiday may be included in the computation of the 2 days’ period mentioned in subsection (5). (Amended 18 of 2016 s. 35)

section.name: s28M
section.heading: Protection of Director and authorized officers

subsection.content: The Director or an authorized officer is not personally liable for anything done or omitted to be done by the Director or officer in good faith in the performance or purported performance of a function under this Division.
The protection conferred by subsection (1) does not affect any liability of the Government for the act or omission.

section.name: s28MA
section.heading: Director may specify form for this Division
section.content: The Director may specify the form of any notice or certificate for the purposes of this Division.

section.name: s28N
section.heading: Legislative Council may amend certain amounts
section.content: The Legislative Council may, by resolution, amend the amount specified in section 28A(2), 28G(2)(c), 28J(3)(b)(iii) or 28L(4)(c).

section.name: s29
section.heading: Secretary may make regulations in respect of Part 3

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, after consultation with the Advisory Council on the Environment, make regulations with respect to all or any of the following matters—

paragraph.name: db
e
paragraph.content: such supplemental provisions as are necessary or expedient for giving full effect to the provisions of this Part;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any matter ancillary or incidental to those specified in this section.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Savings and transitional provisions relating to Product Eco-responsibility (Amendment) Ordinance 2014
section.content: Schedule 5 provides for the savings and transitional arrangements relating to the Product Eco-responsibility (Amendment) Ordinance 2014 (4 of 2014).

section.name: s31
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4

def.name: Distribute
def.leadIn: distribute (分發), in relation to any regulated electrical equipment, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: supply the equipment by way of sale, hire or hire-purchase;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exchange or dispose of the equipment for consideration; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: transmit or deliver the equipment for any of the following activities—

subparagraph.content: supplying by way of sale, hire or hire-purchase;
an exchange or disposal for consideration,

def.continued: but does not include any such act done with a view that the equipment is to be exported in the course of business;

section.def: recycling levy (循環再造徵費) means a levy prescribed for the purposes of this Part by the REE Regulation;
REE Regulation (《受管制電器規例》) means regulations made under section 44;
registered supplier (登記供應商) means a supplier who is registered under section 33;
removal service plan (除舊服務方案) means a plan endorsed under section 41;
residential property (住宅物業) means any real property constituting a separate unit used, or intended to be used, solely or principally for human habitation;
return (申報) means a return submitted under section 38;

seller (銷售商) means a person who carries on a business of distributing regulated electrical equipment to consumers, but does not include a person who only provides service for transporting the equipment that does not belong to the person for another person;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who manufactures regulated electrical equipment in Hong Kong in the course of the person’s business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who, in the course of the person’s business, imports regulated electrical equipment into Hong Kong for distribution, but does not include a person who only provides service for transporting the equipment that does not belong to the person into Hong Kong for another person;

def.name: Use
def.leadIn: use (使用), in relation to any regulated electrical equipment, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exhibit the equipment for business purposes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the equipment to another person as a prize or gift.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Prohibition of distributing regulated electrical equipment without registration

subsection.content: A supplier commits an offence if, not being registered under section 33, the supplier distributes regulated electrical equipment.
A person who is convicted of an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Registration of suppliers

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person applies to be registered as a registered supplier in accordance with the REE Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the application complies with this Ordinance,

section.continued: the Director must register the person as a registered supplier.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Cancellation of registration
section.content: If the Director is satisfied that a registered supplier is no longer a supplier, the Director must cancel the registration of the supplier.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Obligations of Registered Suppliers and Sellers

section.name: s35
section.heading: Receipt must be provided when distributing regulated electrical equipment

subsection.leadIn: If a seller distributes any regulated electrical equipment to a consumer, the seller must, in accordance with the REE Regulation, provide to the consumer—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a receipt with the wording prescribed by the Regulation.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2), entering into an agreement to distribute does not constitute distribution.

For the purposes of subsection (2), providing regulated electrical equipment to an owner or tenant of a residential property under an agreement for sale and purchase, tenancy agreement or renovation agreement for the property without charging specifically for the equipment does not constitute distributing the equipment.
A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Registered supplier must pay recycling levy

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a registered supplier must pay to the Director a recycling levy for any regulated electrical equipment if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the equipment—

subparagraph.content: is manufactured in Hong Kong by the supplier in the course of the supplier’s business; or

is, in the course of the supplier’s business, imported into Hong Kong by the supplier for distribution, but is not imported during the course of a service provided by the supplier for transporting articles into Hong Kong for another person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the supplier—

subparagraph.content: distributes the equipment; or
uses the equipment for the first time.

subsection.content: The recycling levy is payable only once under this section in respect of any regulated electrical equipment.
An outstanding amount of recycling levy payable under this section is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Registered supplier must submit returns

subsection.content: A registered supplier must, in accordance with the REE Regulation, periodically submit returns to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a return, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the amount of recycling levy payable under section 37 by the registered supplier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve a payment notice on the supplier.

subsection.content: A registered supplier must, within the prescribed period after the date the payment notice is served, pay to the Director in the prescribed manner the recycling levy payable under section 37 stated in the payment notice.

If a registered supplier submits a return in respect of a period in a calendar year, the supplier must keep the prescribed records and documents relating to the return during the 5 years after that year.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (3) and (4)—
subsection.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by the REE Regulation.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Registered supplier must submit annual audit report

subsection.content: A registered supplier must, in accordance with the REE Regulation, submit an audit report to the Director every year in respect of the returns submitted by the supplier.

The audit report must be prepared by a certified public accountant (practising) as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588), who must not be an employee of the registered supplier. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Recovering recycling levies by assessment notice

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a person (relevant person)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: distributes regulated electrical equipment in contravention of section 32(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: distributes or uses regulated electrical equipment without having paid the Director the recycling levy payable under section 37 for the equipment (or any part of the levy).

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), entering into an agreement to distribute does not constitute distribution.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may assess—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for regulated electrical equipment mentioned in subsection (1)(a), the amount of recycling levy that would have been payable under section 37 for any regulated electrical equipment if the equipment was distributed in compliance with section 32(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for regulated electrical equipment mentioned in subsection (1)(b), the amount of recycling levy payable under section 37.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may serve an assessment notice (assessment notice) on the relevant person demanding payment of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the assessed amount; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the relevant person has already paid part of that amount under section 37, the outstanding part of that amount.

subsection.content: The Director may replace an assessment notice with another assessment notice served for that purpose.
The Director may at any time withdraw an assessment notice by serving a withdrawal notice to that effect.
An assessment notice served in respect of the recycling levy payable under section 37 for a period must be served within 5 years after the end of that period.

subsection.leadIn: An assessment notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reasons for serving the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how the amount of recycling levy assessed by the Director is calculated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: when and how the relevant person must pay; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the right of the relevant person to appeal against the notice.

subsection.content: The relevant person must pay the amount of recycling levy demanded under an assessment notice within the period prescribed by the REE Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (9) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is convicted of an offence under subsection (10) is also liable to pay—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a surcharge of 5% of the amount of recycling levy that is outstanding at the expiry of the period mentioned in subsection (9); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an additional surcharge of 10% of the amount of recycling levy or the surcharge mentioned in paragraph (a) that is outstanding at the expiry of 6 months after the period mentioned in subsection (9).

subsection.content: An outstanding amount of recycling levy or surcharges payable under this section is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

If an appeal is made under Division 5 of Part 2 against an assessment notice, any amount of recycling levy or surcharges that is outstanding remains payable under this section pending the determination of the appeal unless the Director decides otherwise.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Seller to Arrange for Removal Service

section.name: s41
section.heading: Seller must have endorsed removal service plan

subsection.content: A seller must not distribute regulated electrical equipment to a consumer in the absence of a removal service plan that has been endorsed by the Director.

Without limiting any other ground on which the Director may refuse to endorse a removal service plan, the Director must not endorse a plan unless the Director is satisfied that the plan meets the requirements specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a recycler undertakes to the seller in writing to provide a treatment, reprocessing or recycling service for the electrical equipment and electronic equipment removed by the collector; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicable requirements in the REE Regulation have been complied with.

subsection.content: The collector mentioned in subsection (3)(a) must hold a business registration certificate issued under section 6 of the Business Registration Ordinance (Cap. 310).

The recycler mentioned in subsection (3)(b) must hold a waste disposal licence within the meaning of the Waste Disposal Ordinance (Cap. 354) that authorizes the person to treat, reprocess or recycle e-waste within the meaning of that Ordinance.

For the purposes of subsection (1), providing regulated electrical equipment to an owner or tenant of a residential property under an agreement for sale and purchase, tenancy agreement or renovation agreement for the property without charging specifically for the equipment does not constitute distributing the equipment.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Seller must arrange for removal service

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RemovalTerms
def.leadIn: removal terms (除舊條款) means the terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: agreed between a consumer and a seller who distributes an item of regulated electrical equipment to the consumer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the purpose of which is to provide for the removal, in accordance with subsection (2), of electrical equipment or electronic equipment of the same class as that item of equipment.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a seller distributes an item of regulated electrical equipment (former) to a consumer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the consumer requests, in accordance with the removal terms and any applicable requirements in the REE Regulation, the seller to remove another item of electrical equipment or electronic equipment (latter); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the former and the latter fall within the descriptions of the same item of electrical equipment or electronic equipment set out in column 2 of Part 1 of Schedule 6, (Amended 27 of 2023 s. 9)

subsection.continued: the seller must arrange for the removal of the latter in accordance with the seller’s removal service plan. The seller must not charge the consumer for the arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.content: If a seller distributes any regulated electrical equipment to a consumer, the seller must notify the consumer in writing of the seller’s obligation under subsection (2) before entering into the relevant contract of distribution.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a seller is to distribute any regulated electrical equipment to a consumer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant contract of distribution is to be subject to certain removal terms,

subsection.continued: the seller must notify the consumer in writing of the terms before entering into the contract.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: The removal terms that are applicable to the distribution of regulated electrical equipment to a consumer form part of the terms of the relevant contract of distribution.
The removal terms are void to the extent to which they are inconsistent with the provisions of this Ordinance.

For the purposes of subsection (2), (4) or (5), providing regulated electrical equipment to an owner or tenant of a residential property under an agreement for sale and purchase, tenancy agreement or renovation agreement for the property without charging specifically for the equipment does not constitute distributing the equipment.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Proper disposal of electrical equipment or electronic equipment removed

subsection.leadIn: If a collector provides an electrical equipment or electronic equipment removal service for a seller in accordance with the seller’s removal service plan, the collector must ensure that the equipment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is transferred to a recycler specified in the plan within a reasonable time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is accepted by the recycler.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.content: It is a defence to a charge under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that the person exercised due diligence to avoid committing the offence.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Secretary may make regulations for Part 4

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, after consulting the Advisory Council on the Environment, make regulations in respect of all or any of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for registration under section 33 and the determination of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cancellation of registration under section 34;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the recycling levy for each class of regulated electrical equipment;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the payment of recycling levies by registered suppliers;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the submission of returns by registered suppliers;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the information to be contained in the returns;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the records and documents to be kept by registered suppliers;
the submission of audit reports by registered suppliers;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the prescribed wording for the purposes of section 35(2)(b);

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the requirements of the removal service plan;
the removal service required by section 42.

subsection.content: A regulation made under subsection (1) is subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Exemptions
section.content: The regulated electrical equipment set out in column 3 of Schedule 7 is exempted from the provisions set out opposite to it in column 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Secretary may amend Schedules 6 and 7

subsection.content: The Secretary may, after consulting the Advisory Council on the Environment, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 6 or 7.
A notice made under subsection (1) is subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s46A
section.heading: Savings and transitional provisions relating to Product Eco-responsibility (Amendment) Ordinance 2023
section.content: Schedule 9 provides for the savings and transitional arrangements relating to the Product Eco-responsibility (Amendment) Ordinance 2023 (27 of 2023).

section.name: s47
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5
section.def: container recycling levy (容器循環再造徵費) means the levy prescribed for this Part by the Regulated Articles Regulation;
registered supplier (登記供應商) means a supplier who is registered under section 49;
Regulated Articles Regulation (《受規管物品規例》) means regulations made under section 55;
return (申報) means a return submitted under section 52;

supplier (供應商), in relation to a regulated article, means—(a)a person who, in the course of the person’s business of manufacturing the article, undertakes in Hong Kong the process of sealing the container constituting part of the article; or(b)a person who, in the course of the person’s business, imports the article into Hong Kong for distribution, but does not include a person who—(i)does not own the article; and(ii)only provides a service for transporting the article into Hong Kong for another person.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Prohibition of distributing regulated articles without registration

subsection.content: A supplier commits an offence if, not being registered under section 49, the supplier distributes regulated articles.
A person who is convicted of an offence under subsection (1) is liable to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Registration of suppliers
section.leadIn: The Director must register a person as a registered supplier if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person applies to be registered as a registered supplier in accordance with the Regulated Articles Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the application complies with this Ordinance.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Cancellation of registration
section.content: If the Director is satisfied that a registered supplier is no longer a supplier, the Director must cancel the registration of the supplier.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Registered supplier must pay container recycling levy

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a registered supplier must pay a container recycling levy to the Director for a regulated article if the supplier—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: distributes the article; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consumes the article.

subsection.content: The container recycling levy is payable only once under this section in respect of a regulated article.
An outstanding amount of container recycling levy payable under this section is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Registered supplier must submit returns

subsection.content: A registered supplier must, in accordance with the Regulated Articles Regulation, periodically submit returns to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a return, the Director must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the amount of container recycling levy payable under section 51 by the registered supplier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve a payment notice on the supplier.

subsection.content: A registered supplier must, within the prescribed period after the date the payment notice is served, pay to the Director in the prescribed manner the container recycling levy payable under section 51 stated in the payment notice.
A registered supplier who submits a return in respect of a period in a calendar year must keep the prescribed records and documents relating to the return during the 5 years after that year.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (3) and (4)—
subsection.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by the Regulated Articles Regulation.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Registered supplier must submit annual audit report

subsection.content: A registered supplier must, in accordance with the Regulated Articles Regulation, submit an audit report to the Director every year in respect of the returns submitted by the supplier.

The audit report must be prepared by a certified public accountant (practising) as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588), who must not be an employee of the registered supplier. (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Recovering container recycling levy by assessment notice

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the supplier of a regulated article (relevant supplier)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: distributes the article in contravention of section 48(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: distributes or consumes the article without having paid to the Director the container recycling levy payable under section 51 for the article (or any part of the levy).

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), entering into an agreement to distribute does not constitute distribution.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may assess—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the regulated article mentioned in subsection (1)(a), the amount of container recycling levy that would have been payable under section 51 for the article if the article had been distributed in compliance with section 48(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the regulated article mentioned in subsection (1)(b), the amount of container recycling levy payable under section 51.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may serve an assessment notice (assessment notice) on the relevant supplier demanding payment of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the assessed amount; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the relevant supplier has already paid part of that amount under section 51, the outstanding part of that amount.

subsection.content: The Director may replace an assessment notice with another assessment notice served for that purpose.
The Director may at any time withdraw an assessment notice by serving a withdrawal notice to that effect.
An assessment notice served in respect of the container recycling levy payable under section 51 for a period must be served within 5 years after the end of that period.

subsection.leadIn: An assessment notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reasons for serving the notice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how the amount of container recycling levy assessed by the Director is calculated;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: when and how the relevant supplier must pay; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the right of the relevant supplier to appeal against the notice.

subsection.content: The relevant supplier must pay the amount demanded under the assessment notice within the period prescribed by the Regulated Articles Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (9) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a subsequent conviction, to a fine of $200,000.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is convicted of an offence under subsection (10) is also liable to pay—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: an additional surcharge of 10% of the amount of container recycling levy or the surcharge mentioned in paragraph (a) that is outstanding at the expiry of 6 months after the period mentioned in subsection (9).

subsection.content: An outstanding amount of container recycling levy or surcharges payable under this section is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

If an appeal is made under Division 5 of Part 2 against an assessment notice, any amount of container recycling levy or surcharges that is outstanding remains payable under this section pending the determination of the appeal unless the Director decides otherwise.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Secretary may make regulations for Part 5

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may, after consulting the Advisory Council on the Environment, make regulations in respect of one or more of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for registration under section 49 and the determination in relation to the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cancellation of registration under section 50;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the container recycling levy for each type of regulated article;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the payment of container recycling levy by registered suppliers;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the submission of returns by registered suppliers;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the information to be contained in the returns;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the records and documents to be kept by registered suppliers;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the submission of audit reports by registered suppliers;
an exemption under section 56.

subsection.content: A regulation made under subsection (1) is subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Exemptions for registered supplier with container waste reduction plan

subsection.content: A registered supplier may, in accordance with the Regulated Articles Regulation, apply to the Director for exemption from section 51, 52 or 53 in relation to any type of regulated article.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application fee prescribed by the Regulated Articles Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a container waste reduction plan specifying, in relation to the type of regulated article for which the exemption is sought, the arrangement for the recovery and reuse or recycling of the containers concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must refuse the application if the Director considers that the container waste reduction plan—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is impracticable; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cannot ensure the recovery and reuse or recycling of the containers concerned in an environmentally sound manner.

subsection.content: A registered supplier who is aggrieved by the Director’s refusal of the application may lodge an appeal in accordance with section 13.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may grant the exemption subject to any terms and conditions relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its duration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the implementation of the container waste reduction plan;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: auditing, reporting and record keeping; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other matter the Director considers appropriate.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Secretary may amend Schedule 8

subsection.content: The Secretary may, after consulting the Advisory Council on the Environment, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 8.
A notice made under subsection (1) is subject to the approval of the Legislative Council.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6
section.def: catering business (餐飲業務)—see section 64;
catering premises (餐飲處所)—see section 63;
demand notice (繳款通知書) means a notice served under section 86(2);
fixed penalty (定額罰款) means the penalty referred to in section 83(2);
immediate consumption (即時食用或飲用)—see section 65;
penalty notice (罰款通知書) means a notice given under section 83(2);
premises (處所) includes—(a)any structure; and(b)a cart or other conveyance;

preparation (製備), in relation to any food or drink, means any form of cooking, or any other treatment that changes the form or flavour of the food or drink, but does not include the trimming of fresh produce, and prepared food or drink (經製備食物或飲品) and unprepared food or drink (未經製備食物或飲品) are to be construed accordingly;
recovery order (追討令) means an order made under section 89(2);
specified form (指明格式) means a form specified under section 96;
supply (供應)—see section 59;

wholly contained (完全載於), in relation to any food or drink, means that the food or drink is wholly wrapped or enclosed in, or covered by, any packaging, irrespective of whether there is any hole on the packaging or whether the opening of the packaging is sealed or folded.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Meaning of supply

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part—
subsection.def: supply (供應), in relation to a product, means—(a)provide or distribute the product; or(b)transmit or deliver the product for providing or distributing the product,but does not include any such act done with a view that the product is to be exported in the course of business.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a product is supplied—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether it is supplied as the subject of a transaction or supplied in addition to the subject of a transaction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not it is supplied together with another product as a single item of goods.

subsection.leadIn: However, for the purposes of this Part, a person (provider) who only provides any one or more of the following services is not to be regarded as supplying a product to another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: transporting for another person a product that does not belong to the provider;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: making arrangement to facilitate the collection by another person of a product that does not belong to the provider;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: making arrangement to facilitate the payment by another person for a product that does not belong to the provider.
